directions.dialogText: Let's program some buttons to help us play the Frog Jump game. We've already written the \`setButton()\` function for you. You just need to create a \`function\` called \`frog0Button()\` and type \`jump(0)\` between the \`{ }\`s. Then run your code and use your button!

levels.mission: On line 3 after \`function\`, type \`frog0Button(){}\`. Then, using the RETURN or ENTER button to create a new line between the \`{ }\`s, write \`jump(0)\` on line 4.
levels.tools:
\`jump(number)\`- moves a frog one space in the direction it is facing 

 \`setButton(number, function)\`- assigns the given function to the given button

directions.dialogText: You programmed a button! You'll program all the other buttons just like you programmed button 0. Write a \`function\` called \`frog1Button()\`, and put \`jump(1)\` inside the \`{ }\`s!

levels.mission: At the very bottom, type \`function frog1Button(){}\`. Then using the RETURN or ENTER button to create a new line between the \`{ }\`s, write \`jump(1)\`.
levels.tools:
\`jump(number)\`- moves a frog one space in the direction it is facing 

 \`setButton(number, function)\`- assigns the given function to the given button

levels.mission: At the very bottom, type \`function frog2Button(){}\`. Last, using the RETURN or ENTER button to create a new line between the \`{ }\`s, write \`jump(2)\`.
levels.tools:
\`jump(number)\`- moves a frog one space in the direction it is facing 

 \`setButton(number, function)\`- assigns the given function to the given button

levels.mission: At the very bottom, type \`function frog3Button(){}\`. Last, using the RETURN or ENTER button to create a new line between the \`{ }\`s, write \`jump(3)\`.

\`jump(number)\`- moves a frog one space in the direction it is facing 

 \`setButton(number, function)\`- assigns the given function to the given button

levels.mission: At the very bottom, type \`function frog4Button(){}\`. Last, using the RETURN or ENTER button to create a new line between the \`{ }\`s, write \`jump(4)\`.
levels.tools:
\`jump(number)\`- moves a frog one space in the direction it is facing 

 \`setButton(number, function)\`- assigns the given function to the given button

quiz.text: Which choice below would create the variable \`brownies\` and give it a value of \`12\`?
If the variable \`apples\` has a value of \`5\` and the variable \`oranges\` has a value of \`3\`, which choice below would have a value of \`8\`?
Which would make a variable \`fruit\` and give it a value of the sum of \`apples\` and \`oranges\`?
Which choice would give the variable \`number\` a value of \`8\`?

levels.mission: At the very bottom, type \`function frog5Button(){}\`. Last, using the RETURN or ENTER button to create a new line between the \`{ }\`s, write \`jump(5)\`.
levels.tools:
\`jump(number)\`- moves a frog one space in the direction it is facing 

 \`setButton(number, function)\`- assigns the given function to the given button

directions.dialogText: That's all the code! On the last levels, just run your code and beat the levels! Good luck!

levels.mission: Get the green frogs to the green lilypads and the yellow frogs to the yellow lilypads!
levels.tools: Use each button to jump each frog one open space in the direction it's facing.
levels.tips: You should never let a frog land behind another frog of the same color.

levels.tools: Use each button to jump each frog one open space in the direction it's facing.
levels.tips: You should never let a frog land behind another frog of the same color.
